name: Suspicious Download File Extension with BITS
description:
Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.
Windows Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a low-bandwidth, asynchronous file transfer mechanism exposed through [Component Object Model](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1559/001)
query: (winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-Bits\-Client\/Operational AND (event.code:16403 AND LocalName:(/.*\.[Pp][Ss]1/ OR /.*\.[Ee][Xx][Ee]/ OR /.*\.[Vv][Bb][Ss]/ OR /.*\.[Bb][Aa][Tt]/)) AND (NOT (LocalName:/.*\\[Aa][Pp][Pp][Dd][Aa][Tt][Aa]\\.*/ AND RemoteName:/.*\.[Cc][Oo][Mm].*/)))
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Microsoft\-Windows\-Bits\-Client\/Operational AND (event.code:16403 AND LocalName:(*.ps1 OR *.exe OR *.vbs OR *.bat)) AND (NOT (LocalName:*\\AppData\\* AND RemoteName:*.com*)))`
